exampleContent.title: Sequencing Examples
exampleContent.description: Learn how to arrange items, events, or steps in the correct logical or chronological order
learningPoints: Look for logical connections between items
Consider chronological order (what happens first, second, etc.)
Think about cause and effect relationships
Consider size, importance, or priority order
Use context clues to determine the correct sequence

sections.title: Chronological Sequencing
sections.description: Learn to arrange events in the order they happen in time

examples.title: Daily Morning Routine
examples.explanation: These activities follow a logical morning sequence that most people do in this order.
examples.strategy: Think about what you do first when you wake up, then what comes next.

examples.title: Plant Growth Stages
examples.explanation: This shows the natural progression of how a plant grows from seed to mature plant.
examples.strategy: Consider the biological process and what must happen before each stage.

examples.title: Making a Sandwich
examples.explanation: These steps follow the logical process of sandwich making.
examples.strategy: Think about the physical steps required and what must be done before each step.

sections.title: Size and Number Sequencing
sections.description: Learn to arrange items by size, quantity, or numerical order

examples.title: Numbers from Smallest to Largest
examples.explanation: These numbers are arranged in ascending (increasing) order from smallest to largest.
examples.strategy: Compare the value of each number and arrange from least to greatest.

examples.title: Animals by Size
examples.explanation: These animals are arranged from smallest to largest in typical size.
examples.strategy: Think about the relative sizes of these animals in real life.

sections.title: Process Sequencing
sections.description: Learn to arrange steps in a process or procedure

examples.title: Getting Ready for Bed
examples.explanation: This shows a typical bedtime routine in logical order.
examples.strategy: Think about what you need to do before you can do the next step.

exercises.instruction: Arrange these steps for making a peanut butter sandwich in the correct order.

items.text: Spread peanut butter on one slice
Add jelly to the other slice

exercises.explanation: First get the bread, then spread peanut butter, add jelly, and finally put the slices together.

exercises.instruction: Put these numbers in order from smallest to largest.
exercises.explanation: The numbers in ascending order are: 8, 12, 25, 43.

exercises.instruction: Arrange these events in the order they happen during a day at school.
exercises.explanation: A typical school day: arrive, attend morning classes, eat lunch, then go home.

exercises.instruction: Put these stages of a butterfly's life cycle in the correct order.
exercises.explanation: Butterfly life cycle: egg → caterpillar → chrysalis → butterfly.

exercises.instruction: Arrange these animals from smallest to largest.
exercises.explanation: Size order: Mouse (smallest) → Dog → Elephant → Whale (largest).
